intro: Stenoloma meifolium, commonly known as the meadow bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation areas.
